subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box in the morning
author: bruce halliday

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


steve,
 
very well said, It goes without saying that this is all pure theo=
ry based on personal experience.
but as you know we also recieve advice and=
 knowledge from our friends on the other side from time to time
and that he=
lps us formulate the theories we do. On the premiss of the absentee session=
s, lets agree to disagree
until further experimentation is done or further =
more detailed messages are recieved and posted on the subject.
 
Bruce
Bruc=
e Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: urkel23@...: Wed, 9 =
Jan 2008 23:27:45 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box in the morning




Nick,J=
ust so you know that all this is just personal opinions and i don't believe=
 that Bruce stressed that to you in the post. Every researcher has their ow=
n opinions on how it is done and the results have varied amongst us. There =
is no way to actually explain to someone how these devices work, i couldn't=
 tell you that leaving the box on will make it imprint because there are no=
 facts based on this research thus far. Only personal opinions have been pu=
t out there and what we have experienced for ourselves up to this point. Ev=
erybody needs to do their own research with a little helping hand from thos=
e who have been doing this a little while longer and that's it. You will fi=
nd your own niche in this communication and teach what you've learned to ot=
hers one day. Just remember that nobody can tell how it should be, because =
there is no proof only some personal experiences. That covers all paranorma=
l areas, you can believe or not in something but you can't prove it to othe=
rs or at least i don't think anybody has yet??-Steve .--- In EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Nick,> >=
 You are a new member and a possible researcher so I do not want to get off=
 on the wrong foot> It sounds like you may have taken what I said as critic=
ism, It was not meant to be.> Just experienced advice. There are some resea=
rchers that believe it is beneficial to leave > a box running and unattende=
d, so that our spirit friends can "imprint" to the frequency of the box> > =
That is not at all necessary, Spirit techs do need to imprint to certain bo=
xes but do so through two way communication> you see they also imprint the =
energy signature of the user of the box also. And that can only be accompli=
shed through > communicative interaction during a session. If the box is le=
ft unattended they may only accomplish half of what they need to do.> > Als=
o I have had first hand experience with certain researchers that do practic=
e this lackadaisical us of a box and had begun to > get less and less commu=
nication during attempts at actual sessions and eventually nothing but nega=
tive entities coming through.> I am not saying this is solely due to doing =
an absent session which is what I have come to call it, It entails man6y fa=
ctors.> > But the absent session practice definitely contributes to the ult=
imate failure of communication. > Nick, it is better for you to establish s=
olid research practices in the beginning that will serve to enhance your co=
mmunication > skills and growth in the future.> > Remember your spirit cont=
acts or "technicians" will become not only the facilitators of your link an=
d communication from the> other side but they will become your trusted frie=
nds and protectors. you would never leave your buddy on the phone and go > =
on to something else while he remained on the line calling for you to speak=
 with him. Our spirit friends where people just like us> at one time and th=
e emotions we carry in the physical also carry over to our spirit lives.> >=
 I hope you do not take this as preaching or criticism it is just experienc=
e from communicating with my own techs and friends> and gathering informati=
on on what they feel and expect from us as researchers.> Remember all we ha=
ve to do is turn on a box and listen and record their job to send the commu=
nication > no matter how short the phrase or word is a 1000x harder for the=
m so don't you think they deserve a 100% > of our attention when we open th=
e lines of communication.> > Also in closing let me say that my belief on "=
imprinting" of a box is for boxes like Frank's box and the mini box, for th=
e simple> reason that they are individually made and each carry a slightly =
different frequency range, indicative to that particular box.> The radio sh=
ack hack box on the other hand is manufactured in china most likely on an a=
utomated assembly line so each> circuit board is exactly like the next, thi=
s being the case I believe that when our friends imprinted on the first of =
the RS boxes> it was sufficient for most of the others. That is why people =
experience immediate communication right out of the box.> > So therefore th=
e RS box does not need that grace period to "Imprint"> > These comments and=
 statements are my own hypothesis based on my own extensive research with e=
very type of box that is made to date> and I am only offering it so that it=
 may help others to avoid the toil and mistakes that I have endured.> > tha=
nks for giving me the soap box once again!> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > T=
o: EVP-ITC@...: thegreatwolf@...: Wed, 9 Jan 2008 06:25:30 -0500Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning> > > > > Just FYI, I had stopped checking my=
 email at that time and was trying to get someone to say something. I usual=
ly can't get my self to not pay attention to the box when i turn it on.> > =
On Jan 8, 2008, at 9:19 AM, bruce halliday wrote:> > > > > Nick, My advice =
as a long time researcher is not to just turn the box on and leave it runni=
ng unless you intend to do a session and give your friends on the other sid=
e that are workingextremely hard to send you the communication your undivid=
ed attention. It's kind of like calling someone on the phone and when they =
start a conversation you decide toput the phone down and focus your attenti=
on on other things. There are other researchers that feel that there is not=
hing wrong with this practice and do it on occasionBut I have come to the u=
nderstanding that it is deemed disrespectful and while you may be listening=
 with one ear as you do something else, you will hear a loud curse word or =
nasty statement, that is their way of getting your attention back. I have g=
otten numerous messages about the difficulty of the attempts for them to co=
mmunicate so when I turn the box on it gets my full attention. just some ex=
perienced advice. As for them telling you to close the portal, it could hav=
e two meanings. Sometimes they refer to box thatis turned on and in use as =
a portal for the simple reason that each time we turn a box on to communica=
te it opens a direct open link between our realm and theirs so in essence i=
t is an open door for anything to pass in or out. that is why when I end a =
session I always ask my technician to bring back any spirits that may have =
come through the portal during the session and I ask for conformation and 1=
0 times out of ten will get "OK" or "OK THEY ARE BACK" also they may have m=
eant since you had the box running and where not doing a actual session to =
shut the box so that they could go and not have to protect the open connect=
ion from any negative entities that where able cross through the openportal=
. A few researchers have been receiving numerous messages about the number =
7 within the past month. The only known significance that the number 7 has =
in evp research is the 7 entities that controlled communication back in the=
 eighties and ninetiesduring the spiricom and luxembourg era. To receive th=
is number in messages so often and by more than one researcher, odiouslyhol=
ds some importance which they have not been able or are not ready to convey=
. If you need any help or have any questions please feel free to ask. Bruce=
> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: thegreatwolf@...: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 0=
6:27:07 -0500Subject: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning> > > Hey,Anyone have any=
 odd problems in the morning with using it. I am sitting here checking my e=
mail so i just thought i'd turn it on and... not check my email. Anywho....=
 Then right at about 6:20 i heard a voice say "Nicholas Etheridge please tu=
rn off the dsfnlsd" not quite sure what word it used... possibly portal. I =
just thought it was weird. Also under all of the jumble and this voice spea=
king i heard a deep male voice almost chanting "seven". Not sure if I actua=
lly heard this or its the want to have an excuse to stay home and not take =
the HSAs.Anyway.. just curious if anyone has gotten heard this or if they k=
now something I don't about using the box in the morning.Peace,Nick> > Get =
the power of Windows + Web with the new Windows Live. Get it now! > > > > >=
 > > > > __________________________________________________________> Put yo=
ur friends on the big screen with Windows Vista=AE + Windows Live=99.> http=
://www.microsoft.com/windows/shop/specialoffers.mspx?ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_CPC_M=
ediaCtr_bigscreen_012008>
